creditline: Gift of James F. and Louise H. Bell
description: footed salver with gadrooned rim and foot; engraved Dudley coat-of-arms; fleur-de-lis mark with circle in a heart on top beneath coat-of-arms; mark rare after 1705, so paten probably dates before that time
inscription:
Mark

Engraved in the center is the coat of arms of Dudley, for Governor Joseph Dudley.
markings:
<IC> in shield

Maker\'s mark struck once on upper surface.
title: Footed salver
